titlestmt.titleproper: Center for the Humanities at Tufts RecordsUA243

publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-24 09:31:40 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Center for the Humanities at Tufts Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Center for the Humanities at Tufts

did.abstract: This collection contains the records of the Center for the Humanities at Tufts.
did.langmaterial: Collection contents are predominantly in English. One lecture and transcript contains French as well as English.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Center for the Humanities at Tufts, 2016-2018.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized in three series: Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities; 2018 accessions; and Newsletters.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Center for Humanities at Tufts was established circa 2008, according to citations in the 2008-2009 Factbook, to foster interdisciplinary humanities work in comparative literature, comparative religion, world history, philosophy, anthropology, and the arts, to innovate new research and reflection. The Center hosts public lectures, seminars, conferences and colloquia by visiting artists, writers, and scholars, and brings together faculty, postdoctoral, and dissertation fellows. Fellows participate in a research seminar and attend monthly public events with distinguished visiting scholars.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Center for the Humanities at Tufts Records, 2008-2018. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is fully processed. Processing of the 2018 accessions and Newsletters was completed by Leah Edelman in 2018. Physical materials were placed in archival folders and boxes where necessary. Digital materials were virus checked, bagged, and ingested to the digital library. A file-level inventory and series-level descriptions were created and the finding aid was updated at the time of processing.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Department of English Records, 1906-2016. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains videos of public lectures delivered as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities series, transcripts of said lectures, and PDF exports of Storify collections of tweets sent during the lecture. It also contains videos of two events sponsored by CHAT, flyers and brochures for CHAT events from 2008 through 2016, CHAT office files, and newsletters published by CHAT for academic years 2016-2017 and 2017-2018.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University. No further documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

did.unittitle: Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes video of lectures given as part the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: South Sudan: The Road to Civil War

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video of a lecture by Mahmood Mamdani on international relations, African politics, and questions of crime and punishment in the case of mass violence in civil war situations such as South Sudan.

did.unittitle: Migrations, Islands, and the Creative Economy
did.langmaterial: This lecture is mostly in English, but also contains phrases and paragraphs in French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video of lecture by Françoise Lionnet in which shares perspectives on recent artistic and literary works inspired by migrant crises in both the Indian Ocean and the Mediterranean sea and focus more specifically on the Comoros archipelago and the island of Mayotte, that "ultra peripheral" region of "Europe," she considers the multilingual work of poet and dramatist Soeuf Elbadawi to test the critical effectiveness of literature in the world as agent of cultural change. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Colonialism, Slavery, and the Archive: Old and New Practices

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video of a panel on old and new practices of archiving and curating among scholars and writers, activists and artists, engaged in the histories and legacies of colonialism and slavery. This panel was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Plantation Dispossession and the Futures of Black Embodiment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video of a panel exploring the futures of Black embodiment, both futures-past and futures-present, and the place of the Black body in the history of the present, and the futures to which it signals. This panel was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Mahmood Mamdani, "South Sudan: The Road to Civil War" Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during Mahmood Mamdani's lecture "South Sudan: The Road to Civil War" delievered as part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Françoise Lionnet, "Migrations, Islands, and the Creative Economy" Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during Françoise Linonnet's lecture "Migrations, Islands, and the Creative Economy" delievered as part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: CHAT Lost Histories Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during a panel entitled "Colonialism, Slavery, and the Archive: Old and New Practices," part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: CHAT: Plantation Dispossession and the Futures of Black Emobdiment Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during a panel entitled "Plantation Dispossession and the Futures of Black Embodiment," part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Comparative Postcolonial Theory and the Question of Chinese Empire

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by Shu-mei Shih exploring how the emergence of Shinophone studies is altering the landscape of postcolonial theory. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Colonial Memory and Trauma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by Debarati Sanyal and Stef Craps exploring how coloniality may compel us to rething the very structures of "memory" and "trauma" within the humanities. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: CHAT: Colonial Memory and Trauma Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during Debarati Sanyal and Stef Craps's lecture "Colonial Memory and Trauma" delievered as part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: The Social Life of DNA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by Alondra Nelson consering how ancetry genetics (data derived from human bodies) is today employed to make raical statesments and justice claims aobut the past in the present. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: CHAT: Alondra Nelson, "The Social Life of DNA" Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during Alondra Nelson's lecture "The Social Life of DNA" delievered as part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Rethinking the Human: Epistemology/Therapeutics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by Emily Martin and Lawrence Cohen. This conversation centers the project of rethinking the human in the project of rethinking intellectual boundary-making, constellating innovations in medicine, technology, and clinical therapeutics as horizons for humanist ethics and counter-ethics. This panel was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Empire of Religion

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by David Chidester considering the genealogy of comparative religion. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: The Politics of Human Rights

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by Judith Butler considers the operations of human rights in critical legal studies, political thought, and postcolonial theory, with consideration of situated struggles in various global locations. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Sovereignty, Settler Colonialism, Territoriality and Resistance

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lecture by Audra Simpson and Jessica Cattelino which considers practices that seek to create alternative sovereignties, geographies, and conceptions of belonging and intimacy. Funded by the Andrew Mellon Foundation, Tufts Collaborates, and the Center for Humanities at Tufts. This lecture was presented as part of the Mellon Sawyer Seminar in Comparative Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Religion's Imperial Pasts, Global Futures Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during a lecture by David Chidester entitled "Empire of Religion," part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: The Politics of Human Rights Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during Judith Butler's lecture "The Politics of Human Rights," part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: Sovereignty, Settler Colonialism, Territoriality and Resistance Twitter Storify export

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: PDF export of a Storify created from tweets sent during a panel with Audra Simpson and Jessica Cattelino entitled "Sovereignty, Settler Colonialism, Territoriality and Resistance," part of the Melon Sawyer Seminar in Global Humanities.

did.unittitle: 2018 accessions

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains videos of two events at CHAT: the first titled "Material Worlds: Genealogies of Race and Nature" by Mel Y. Chen, Associate Professor of Gender and Women's Studies at the University of California, Berkeley; Jake Kosek, Associate Professor of Geography at the University of California, Berkeley; and Alexander Blanchette, Assistant Professor of Anthropology, Tufts University. In this symposium, Chen, Osek, and Blanchette explore alternative biologies of race and racism, not through the most common routes of blood, skin or gene, but through other material biologies and rethinkings of life, matter, human, nature, and machine. The second event titled "Readings from The Blue Clerk, ars poetica" features poet, novelist, and essayist Dionne Brand reading from her book, The Blue Clerk (McClelland and Stewart and Duke UP, 2018). This series also contains flyers and brochures for CHAT events from 2008 through 2016, and CHAT office files.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by CHAT, 2018, accession UA-2018-049, UA-2018-064, and UA-2019-029.

did.unittitle: Material Worlds: Genealogies of Race and Nature

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Material Worlds: Genealogies of Race and Nature" by Mel Y. Chen, Associate Professor of Gender and Women's Studies at the University of California, Berkeley; Jake Kosek, Associate Professor of Geography at the University of California, Berkeley; and Alexander Blanchette, Assistant Professor of Anthropology, Tufts University.

did.unittitle: Readings from The Blue Clerk, ars poetica.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Readings from The Blue Clerk, ars poetica." Dionne Brand reads from her latest book, The Blue Clerk (McClelland and Stewart and Duke UP, 2018).
